### 2. Hammerspoon

> [App Link](https://www.hammerspoon.org/). Creates global shortcuts

Uses `Lua` programming language to assign keybindings to certain actions. Here a sneak peek of what can you do.
```lua
--- Open App
function open(name)
    return function()
        hs.application.launchOrFocus(name)
        if name == 'Finder' then
            hs.appfinder.appFromName(name):activate()
        end
    end
end
```
The above function can be called to open an `app: Google Maps` by an i.e. the shortcut: `âŒ˜ + M`
```lua
--- Binding Keys
hs.hotkey.bind({ "cmd" }, "M", open("Google Maps"))
```

For complete implementation visit, this [repo](https://github.com/danilotpnta/hammerspoon-config).

For Windows alternative see the code below:
